member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: A non-nullable parameter, field, or property may be null.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: A nullable parameter, field, or property should never be null.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullAttribute
member.summary: A non-nullable parameter, field, property, or return value may be null.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: A nullable parameter, field, property, or return value will never be null.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: A non-nullable argument may be null when the method returns the specified boolean value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: A nullable argument won't be null when the method returns the specified boolean value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute
member.summary: A return value, property, or argument isn't null if the argument for the specified parameter isn't null.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: A method or property never returns. In other words, it always throws an exception.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute
member.summary: This method or property never returns if the associated boolean parameter has the specified value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute
member.summary: The listed member won't be null when the method returns.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: The listed member won't be null when the method returns the specified boolean value.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Azure.Client.Identity.ChainedTokenCredentialBuilder
member.summary: Allows creating instances of to use as to access Azure client libraries.
member.remarks: This allows chaining credentials to access Azure resources from the following list: , , , and . Notice that any given credential type can only be used once in the chain (except ). Since the instance is passed after creating to the client library, access tokens caching will be managed by the client library itself. That will not be the case if is invoked directly. In that case, the caller should manage the token lifetime, renewal, etc.
